lines.text: There is no sincerity like a woman telling a lie.
How dare he make love to me and not be a married man.
You know, I'm too old for this sort of evening. I always was.
This is a very diplomatic matter, I don't want you putting your foot in it.
I deal with diplomatic matters every day without feet.
Oh, I tell you. Women are not the sensitive sex. That's one of the grand delusions of literature. Men are the true romanticists.
I like a man with a glass in his hand.
